title: 105_hr1847
content: The Act may be cited as the "Telemarketing Fraud Prevention Act of 1998" and includes provisions for criminal forfeiture of fraud proceeds. Section 982 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include forfeiture of property used in telemarketing offenses. Section 982 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include forfeiture of property used in telemarketing offenses, by expanding the subsection to include (a)(8) in addition to (a)(1) and (a)(6). SEC. 3. Penalty for telemarketing fraud is increased to mandatory. SEC. 4. Conspiracy offenses added to telemarketing fraud enhancement. SEC. 5. Mandatory restitution clarified for victims of enhanced penalty offenses. SEC. 6. Federal sentencing guidelines amended. The term "telemarketing" is defined in section 2326 of title 18, United States Code. The United States Sentencing Commission is directed to increase penalties for offenses related to telemarketing and submit policy recommendations to Congress. The United States Sentencing Commission is required to enhance penalties for offenses involving telemarketing, including cases with sophisticated means or a large number of vulnerable victims. The United States Sentencing Commission is mandated to enhance penalties for telemarketing offenses, considering aggravating or mitigating circumstances and ensuring guidelines align with statutory directives. The Commission must also meet sentencing purposes outlined in the law and take necessary actions to implement the Telemarketing Fraud Prevention Act of 1998 promptly. According to the Sentencing Reform Act of 1987, the Commission must submit emergency guidelines or amendments to Congress and set an effective date not earlier than 30 days after submission. SEC. 7. FALSE ADVERTISING OR MISUSE OF NAME TO INDICATE UNITED STATES MARSHALS SERVICE. Section 709 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to prohibit the unauthorized use of United States Marshals Service words, logos, or insignias in connection with any publication or production to falsely imply affiliation with the agency. The unauthorized use of United States Marshals Service words, logos, or insignias in any publication or production to falsely imply affiliation with the agency is prohibited. SEC. 8. Amends Section 2703(c)(1)(B) of title 18, United States Code to allow disclosure of subscriber information for law enforcement investigations of telemarketing fraud.
